column4: Hey...! Can anybody help me? I've got an laptop, Acer TravelMate 5710. Sound works correctly on the build-in speakers, but the standard "green" speaker-out doesn't work. I don't know how to fix it - in the ALSA MIXER I've got only: Master, PCM and Digital in "Capture". Build-in microphone doesn't work too... But camera works good.
Are you sure the speakers work and that the output works on windows and such?
Speaker works, but I do not know anything about output.
did you try searching google? I've never heard of anything like this happening.
Let's look at http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/55765/ - log from alsamixer.
bad news, it seems that there is a bug with that chipset that disables internal and external mic. However, no info on the speakers yet.
So, what I have to do?
as of right now, nothing... I'm still looking for your speakers right now
Are there any adv. settings?
sorry, no. It's a bug with the driver, and unless you want to write it yourself, you just have to wait for a fix.
however, if you know C, I've been told it's not too hard to write drivers.
I know C++ a really little...
But, are you sure? How do you know it?
sorry, but your probably just going to have to wait for a fix then. It's documented here: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Gutsy_Intel_HD_Audio_Controller
Ok, thx for all. but what with the OSS? Does it use the same driver?
as far as I know, yes.
I'll try on Vista...
Thx for all.
But try to do that: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/LaptopTestingTeam/AcerTravelmate6292?
But try to do that: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/LaptopTestingTeam/AcerTravelmate6292 ?
that seems to be able to solve your speaker problem, I'd try that.
OK, that sounds cool, THX ;).
